meanings.sent1: The teacher worked hard to foster creativity in her students.
meanings.sent2: Parents often foster a love for reading by reading to their children.
meanings.sent3: The garden seemed to foster a secret community of tiny fairies.
meanings.sent4: The warm sunlight seemed to foster the growth of the delicate flowers.
meanings.sent5: The supportive environment helped foster a sense of belonging among the team.

meanings.sent1: The kind family decided to foster a puppy until it found a permanent home.
meanings.sent2: The organization works to foster children in need of a safe place to stay.
meanings.sent3: The busy household was about to foster a mischievous kitten for the weekend.
meanings.sent4: The animal shelter was able to foster many pets during the busy holiday season.
meanings.sent5: The caring volunteers stepped in to foster the injured bird back to health.

meanings.definition: Promote the growth or development of (something)
meanings.sent1: Regular exercise can foster a healthy lifestyle.
meanings.sent2: Good nutrition is essential to foster strong bones and muscles.
meanings.sent3: The rainy weather seemed to foster the growth of mushrooms in the forest.
meanings.sent4: Positive feedback can foster a sense of confidence in individuals.
meanings.sent5: The supportive community worked together to foster the growth of local businesses.
